xxl.core.math.statistics.parametric.aggregates
Class ReservoirSample

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.math.functions.AggregationFunction<Number,Number[]>
      xxl.core.math.statistics.parametric.aggregates.ReservoirSample
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class ReservoirSample
extends AggregationFunction<Number,Number[]>

This class provides sampling algorithms for the usage with the aggregator cursor. Anytime after initialization the returned array of objects represents an iid (identically independent distributed) random sample of the already consumed data. Note that the size of the used entirety must not be known in advance. Generally, there are four types of implementation available based on [Vit85]: Jeffrey Scott Vitter, Random Sampling with a Reservoir, in ACM Transactions on Mathematical Software, Vol. 11, NO. 1, March 1985, Pages 37-57. The reservoir sampling strategy describes how the sample is drawn from the given dataset. In [Vit85] four types are intended: Type R, X, Y and Z.

Performance of Algorithms R, X, Y, and Z

Algorithm Average number of uniform random variates Average CPU time
R N-n O(N)
X 2n ln (N/n) O(N)
Y 2n ln (N/n) O ( n^2 ( 1+ log (N/n)*log (log(N/n))))
Z 3n ln (N/n) O(n(1+log(N/n)))

Type Y is not implemented so far due to the lack of information for computing the needed distribution for the used random variable. All the other three types of how to sample are implemented as described in [Vit85].

Objects of this type are recommended for the usage with aggregator cursors!


Consider the following example: 
  Iterator it = new Aggregator( new DiscreteRandomNumber(new JavaDiscreteRandomWrapper(100),50), new ReservoirSample ( 10, new XType(10))  );
        while ( it.hasNext() ){
                Object [] o = (Object []) it.next();
                if(o==null) continue;
                for (int i=0; i< o.length; i++)
                        System.out.print(": " + o[i]); // print the current output
        }
 <\code><\pre>

Nested Class Summary





static class
ReservoirSample.AbstractStrategy



          This class provides a preimplementation of the ReservoirSamplingStrategy
 interface to minimize the effort required to implement this interface.		





static interface
ReservoirSample.ReservoirSamplingStrategy



          Interface providing a strategy for reservoir sampling techniques.		





static class
ReservoirSample.RType



          Type R strategy computes for every object of the underlying iterator
 the designated position in the reservoir.		





static class
ReservoirSample.XType



          Type X strategy computes first the number of objects to skip and then
 the position in the reservoir for the object followed by the last one skipped.		





static class
ReservoirSample.ZType



          Type Z strategy computes first the number of objects to skip and then
 the position in the reservoir for the object followed by the last one skipped.

ReservoirSample


public ReservoirSample(int n,
                       ReservoirSample.ReservoirSamplingStrategy strategy)
                throws IllegalArgumentException




Constructs a new aggregation function of type sampling.





Parameters:
n - size of the sample to draw
strategy - sampling strategy used for determine the
 position of the treated object
 in the sampling reservoir

Throws:

IllegalArgumentException - if the size of the reservoir isn't at least 1

Method Detail







invoke


public Number[] invoke(Number[] oldReservoir,
                       Number next)




Two-figured function call for supporting aggregation by this function.
 Each aggregation function must support a function call like agg_n = f (agg_n-1, next),
 where agg_n denotes the computed aggregation value after n steps, f
 the aggregation function, agg_n-1 the computed aggregation value after n-1 steps
 and next the next object to use for computation.
 This method delivers only null as aggregation result as long as the aggregation
 has not yet initialized.





Specified by:
invoke in class AggregationFunction<Number,Number[]>






Parameters:
oldReservoir - result of the aggregation function in the previous computation step
 (iid sample of previous treated data)
next - next object used for computation

Returns:
aggregation value after n steps (new reservoir containing an iid>/tt> sample)










main


public static void main(String[] args)




The main method contains some examples to demonstrate the usage
 and the functionality of this class.





Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to
                submit parameters when the main method is called.
